What's worse about it is that if you don't get immediate medical attention if you do break your penis it can heal wrong. . . meaning that you could wind up with your penis being completely literally bent out of shape. . . imagine a straight line. . now imagine a right corner.

topics.body:
"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5535dc106368721766500700#post_5535dc106368721766500700
That dude just murdered an innocent little wolf spider. Wolf spiders are nonaggressive and their bites do little more than cause a bit of skin irritation. Those little spiders coming off the big spider. They were spiderlings. BABIES. And that dude just murdered their mother.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5535dce363687233350d0700#post_5535dce363687233350d0700
Well, if you think about it, people don't really know what kind of spiders they deal with when they see one. They just go all "Nope, fuck that."
Also,
!http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/a4/Wolf_spider_(Lycosidae).jpg!
That spider in the gif is one tiny-ass wolf spider.

"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5535debd63687231ff220100#post_5535debd63687231ff220100
No. I just call them babies.

"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5535debe6368726e0da60600#post_5535debe6368726e0da60600
That's because to humans, THEY ARE WRONG. Eight legs, two body segments, and between four to eight eyes. They look and feel alien to us. That's why people fear them so much. That and a combination of social stigma surrounding them. A lot of people are TAUGHT  to fear spiders.
